questions.text: What movie did they watch at the bar?
questions.explanation:
"It's a Wonderful Life".

	The movie apparently ran the entire day because every time they showed the TV this is what they were watching. "It's a Wonderful Life" stars Jimmy Stewart and Donna Reed.

questions.text: What day were they scheduled to work on?
questions.explanation:
Christmas Eve.

	Sam told Rebecca that it was a holiday. When she said it isn't he said, "But it's a holiday eve." She scheduled herself to work that evening as well to show she wasn't pulling rank.

questions.text: What part did Woody get in "The Story of Snow"?
questions.explanation:
King of the Flakes.

	Carla found it very fitting that Woody would be cast as the King of the Flakes. Woody was just happy that he landed a role in a theatre production.

questions.text: Who got a job as Santa?
questions.explanation:
Norm.

	That evening all the Santa's from Santa school were at Cheers having drinks together. The woman who helped Sam was worried that a child might walk in and see this, even though it was really late on Christmas Eve. She said, "What a horrible time to find out."

questions.text: Who, from Cheers, didn't have a gift for Rebecca?
questions.explanation:
Sam.

	Sam didn't realize they would be exchanging gifts with Rebecca. Carla told him that it was a tradition called "sucking up".

questions.text: What did Sam intend to give Rebecca for Christmas?
questions.explanation:
ear muffs.

	The woman who let Sam buy a gift off of her accidentally gave Sam the wrong box so Rebecca ended up opening diamond earrings instead of ear muffs. Sam not wanting to  look like a fool ended up buying the earrings so Rebecca could keep them. He then thought that his expensive gift got him a romantic dinner with Rebecca until Carla informs him that Rebecca invited everyone in the bar to her house.

wallet.

	Woody was expecting something great when he saw what Sam bought for Rebecca. He was disappointed when he found out all he got was a wallet.

pink soap.

	Carla told him that his gift "bites". When she found out that Sam thought he was having a romantic dinner with Rebecca she started to laugh at him and said that that made up for the soap.

Balthazar.

	Woody was talking to the woman that helped Sam out when he said this. She said that Melchior was the best.

questions.text: Who said "God bless us everyone" at the end of the episode?
questions.explanation:
Woody.

	"God bless us everyone" is a line from "A Christmas Carol" spoken at the very end by Tiny Tim. It was fitting that Woody spoke the line at the end of this episode since he was the most innocent of the gang at Cheers.
